Privacy Policy

PRIVACY POLICY



Conferience Ltd . (“Conferience”, “we” or “us”) provides an event management solution to help Event Organizers or Organizers (“Clients”)provide various tools and solutions (“Services”) , through a cloud-based platform (“Platform”), (“Services”) that enable real-time active engagement of Participants/App Users (“Users”) at any kind of event physically or virtually.

“You” refers to both Event Organizers and Users unless specified otherwise.



Introduction

At Conferience, we respect your privacy and personal information. We have crafted the following policy in order to be clear and straightforward as much as possible. Our aim is for You—our members—to always feel informed and empowered with respect to your privacy on Conferience.

“Personal Information” means any information that may be used, either as a single unit or in combination with other information, to personally identify an individual, including, but not limited to, a first and last name, a personal profile, an email address, a home or other physical address or other contact information.



ANONYMOUS OR IDENTIFIED ACCESS FOR USERS

Which personal information we collect, when and how we collect it

  1. No login processes. We do not currently require Users to provide Personal Information in order to have access to the event app. Users are anonymous in any of the services and features provided by Conferience. Unless Users are asked to type their names on any feature, such as Questions, Voting, Ideas, Event or Speakers’ Evaluation, in the web app, native app of Conferience, Branded web app or native app created or powered by Conferience, there is no way for them to be identified.

  2. Registration - Login feature : We do receive and/or collect Personal Information from Users where there is a Login process. Event Organizers may use Conferience via a Login and Registration process. In this process, Users are identified in all sections, services and features of Conferience, as Users provide their email, name, password, organization, telephone numbers and other personal data.

  3. Personal data collection : We do receive and/or collect Personal Information from Users where it has been asked by the event Organizer through Voting, Question, Ideas, Event evaluation, Attendee’s List etc. In this process, Users are identified in all sections, services and features of Conferience, as Users provide some of their personal data.



‘Contact Us’ Information.

When you send us a “Contact Us” request, either by submitting an online form, that is available on our site and our app, or by sending an email to an email address that we display, you may be required to provide us with certain information, such as your name and email address.

Location Data via the Navigate me feature.

We may provide certain location-based services (“Location Services”) in connection with the Services that are dependent on data related to the geographic location of your mobile device (“Location Data”). If you choose to participate in these Location Services, via the Navigate me feature, You agree that we may collect or obtain your Location Data. You should be able to use the settings on your mobile device to turn off location-sharing features.



NEPANDA.com

A third-party service Conferience uses and takes advantage of its services, is Nepanda. Nepanda provides networking solutions to the Organizer and participants via its platform and web application. Nepanda works under an identification process via a Linkedin, Facebook or Nepanda account. W In the identification process, it asks from the participant for their first name, last name, email, password, business title, company, skills, picture and general profile, either taking it from Linkedin, Facebook or creating a new one on Nepanda. You can delete your account anytime via your profile at Nepanda.com.


Usage of reCAPTCHA
We use reCAPTCHA on our site. ReCAPTCHA is a free service from Google that helps protect websites from spam and abuse. A “CAPTCHA” is a turing test to set humans apart from bots . It is easy for humans to solve, but hard for “bots” and other malicious software to figure out.
You acknowledge and understand that the reCAPTCHA API works by collecting hardware and software information, such as device and application data, and sending this data to Google for analysis. The information collected in connection with your use of the service will be used for improving reCAPTCHA and for general security purposes. It will not be used for personalized advertising by Google. For more information, you can visit http://www.google.com/about/company/user-consent-policy.html


ACCESS FOR EVENT ORGANIZERS

Event Organizer Account

Event Organizers can create an account on the official website of Conferience after choosing one of the subscription plans and getting the first credentials from us via email.

When you decide to create an account, you automatically agree to our Terms of Service.

You can delete your account anytime, as it is described on the Creation and Deletion of Account paragraph on the Terms of Service.



INFORMATION WE COLLECT

We collect data from any open-ended questions from any poll or voting, as well as from questions or ideas participants ask or share via the corresponding features of Conferience app. Unless You login to Conferience or type Your name to any of the Questions, Ideas and Voting fields, the data You provide are anonymous.

With regard to the organizers, we collect data from them, such as email, name corporation, business title and from each event the date, venue, speakers’ profiles from the Agenda or logos with URLs and profiles from Sponsors’ information. Organizers are always able to change the password via the Content Management System.

Device Information.

We collect device-specific information, such as Your hardware model, operating system version and screen resolution.

Log Information.

When you use our services, we automatically collect and store certain information in server logs. However, because of anonymity, we have no way of knowing personal information. We can only acquire device related information. Information that we collect includes but is not limited to:

  • details on how you used our service, such as your search queries.

  • information about date and timestamps of use.

  • details about your connection, such as IP address, date, time, edge-location, ssl-protocol, ssl-cipher or time-taken to serve your requested site.

  • device event information such as crashes, system activity, hardware settings, browser type, browser language, the date and time of your request and referral URL.

  • cookies that may uniquely identify your browser.

Location Information . When you use the Conferience "Navigate me" feature, we may collect and process information about your actual location. Currently, we only use IP address as the source of information to determine approximately your current location.

Local Storage . We may collect and store information (including personal information) locally on your device using mechanisms such as browser web storage (including HTML 5) and application data caches.



CUSTOMER DATA

Organizer is and continues to be the owner of all data, content, communication information (including personal information), software or material owned, held, used or created by or on behalf of Users.

Organizers and Users grant Conferience the right to access, use, process, and elaborate their data in order for Conferience to provide, maintain and improve its Services, to prevent or address Service, security or integrity and solve any technical issues.

Conferience will take standard industry measures to back up all Clients and Users data stored using the Services.

Protection of Clients and Users data is a top priority for Conferience and it will maintain administrative, physical, and technical safeguards. These safeguards will include measures for preventing unauthorized access, use, modification, deletion and disclosure of Clients and Users by Conferience personnel.

Organizers may ensure, on their own responsibility, that they protect their Users data and use, at a minimum, reasonable data practices for maintaining the confidentiality and security of their Users data and preventing unauthorized access. Organizers bear sole responsibility for downloading their data, whether during the event or after the event, either via XL or via PDF format creating backups out of the Conferience platform. They are solely responsible for the security, protection and backup of the extracted data as well as the events Data.

Conferience treats all Clients and Users data in accordance with the principles of confidentiality.

Possession of Clients and Users data

You own all Your data at all times. Conferience treats all your data according to the principles of confidentiality.



DATA PRIVACY

Any information we collect through our Platform about Clients and App Users is governed by our Privacy Policy. You hereby acknowledge that you have read and agree to be bound by our Privacy Policy.

Conferience and its Clients represent and warrant that

  • will provide at least the same level of privacy protection as is required by the EU-US Privacy Shield Principles and the Swiss-US Privacy Shield Principles (the “Principles”) with respect to such information;

  • will take reasonable and appropriate steps to ensure that they effectively process the personal information transferred in a manner consistent with the Principles;

  • will notify App Users if we determine that you can no longer meet the obligation to provide the same level of protection as required by the Principles;

  • may take reasonable and appropriate steps to stop and remediate unauthorized processing;

  • may provide a summary or a representative copy of the relevant privacy provisions of this Agreement to any authorities upon request;

  • comply with all applicable laws with respect to such information, including, but not limited to, the European Union’s General Data Protection Regulation (2016/EC/679) (the “GDPR”).



Restrictions

Unless it is authorized by us, you agree not to, and shall not permit any third party to: (i) license, redistribute, sell, lease, lend or rent the Platform or the Services; (ii) disassemble, reverse engineer, decompile, decrypt or attempt to derive the source code of the software operating the Service; (iii) copy, modify, improve or create derivative works or features of the Service or any part thereof; (iv) circumvent, disable or otherwise interfere with security-related features of the Service or features that prevent or restrict use or copying of any content or that enforce limitations on use of the Service; (v) remove, alter or obscure any proprietary notice or identification, including copyright, trademark, patent or other notices, contained in or displayed on or via the Service; (vi) use any communication system provided by the Service to send unauthorized and/or unsolicited commercial communications; (vii) use the Conferience name, logo or trademarks without our prior written consent; and/or (viii) use the Service to violate any applicable laws, rules or regulations, or for any unlawful, harmful, irresponsible or inappropriate purpose or in any manner that breaches this Agreement.



Confidentiality

We maintain the confidentiality of all information and data we collect, receive or process in connection with this Agreement and shall not, directly or indirectly, copy, release, disclose, divulge or permitaccess to any such confidential information prior to Your written consent . The restrictions in this section do not apply to any information which: (i) at the time of disclosure or thereafter is generally available to and known by the public or any third party ( excluding the case of an unauthorized disclosure directly or indirectly by the non-disclosing party), (ii) was or becomes available to the non-disclosing party on a non-confidential basis from a source other than the disclosing party, (iii) has been independently acquired or developed by the non-disclosing party without violating any of its obligations under this Agreement.



Data management, elaboration and analysis

According to our policy, we examine data only cumulatively in order to extract results for improving our Services and providing You with technical support. We do not elaborate personally identifiable data.



Use of Anonymous information

We may use Anonymous Information or disclose it to third party service providers in order to improve our Services and enhance your experience with them. We may also disclose Anonymous Information (with or without compensation) to third parties, including advertisers and partners. “Anonymous Information” means information which does not enable identification of an individual User, such as aggregated information about the use of our Services.



Opting Out.

If you are an Event Organizer you should know that we keep your email in our Conferience community. This way we can keep you updated on our promotions, new features or any technical or user interface improvements.

You may choose not to receive future promotional, advertising or other Service-related emails from us by selecting the unsubscribe link at the bottom of each email. Please note that, even if you opt out of receiving the foregoing emails, we will still send you a response to any “Contact Us” request as well as administrative emails (for example, in connection with a password reset request) that are necessary to facilitate your use of the Services

Advertisement

Event Organizers have the right to advertise through the app via banners, different solutions and products from sponsors or other third parties. Users accept to receive advertisements through the app.



Ownership of Your Data

You retain any and all rights you may possess to data You input and host on the Conferience platform, or data collected from others by Conferience on your behalf.

Contact information will be stored for end users that agree to provide such information through the web-app platform. In accordance with the UK Law Freedom of Information Act 2000 and Data Protection Act 1998, You have a right to view, alter and delete all personal data concerning you, collected by Conferience or its Event Organizers. To exercise these rights, You can send an email to the address info@conferience.com . Conferience will delete all your data up to 30 days after we receive your email.

In order to delete your account and all your data, in case you are a User, your request must be presented in writing by the email address used in registration to Conferience , or online and automatically via its platform, and, in case you are an Organizer, via the Content Management System.

Conferience agrees to make every effort to protect personal data in order to, notably, prevent this data from being distorted, damaged or communicated to non-authorized third parties. Conferience agrees to inform You in case of violation of this data, if it deems it necessary, up to 72 hours after recognizing the violation on the data.

Conferience will use Your data only for the purpose of providing web-app platform and services as contemplated hereunder and in accordance with all applicable data privacy laws and regulations. Conferience may, also, claim ownership, notably for purposes of proof, of any deed, document or recording on any medium, including established electronic media, either received or stored directly or indirectly by Conferience in a database.



Sensitive Personal Information

Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in this Agreement, Clients and Users acknowledge and agree that any use of Conferience in order to transmit, process or store Sensitive Personal Information (as defined below) is unnecessary for the use of Conferience . Therefore, Clients and Users shall be solely responsible for any such use of Conferience by Clients or their employees, agents, subcontractors and Conferience shall bear no risk or liability for the same matter. "Sensitive Personal Information" shall be defined as (a) social security numbers; (b) passport numbers or other government issued id numbers, date of birth and/or gender, except solely to the extent required by applicable regulations of the Department of Homeland Security or other government regulatory body; (c) health or medical information (other than food allergies or medical contact information); (d) financial account information; and (e) other information which a reasonable person would recognize as being highly sensitive ( excluding, for avoidance of doubt, contact information such as name, mailing address, email address, and phone number).

We will ask for your consent before using information for any purpose other than those that are set out in this Privacy Policy.

Access/Accuracy.

We wish to maintain accurate Personal Information, to the extend that you provide us with such information If you would like to delete or correct any of your other Personal Information that we may be storing, and you have difficultiy doing so alone, you may submit an access request by sending an email to info@conferience.com . Your email should include adequate details of your request. Notwithstanding the foregoing, we may retain certain Personal Information in connection with pending or potential legal disputes, as required by law enforcement or other government agencies, or as requested by you, in order to process and maintain records of financial transactions.



Security

The security of Personal Information is important to us. We follow generally accepted industry standards, including the use of appropriate administrative, physical and technical safeguards, to protect the Personal Information submitted to us. However, no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. Therefore, while we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security or confidentiality. If you have any questions about security on the Service, you can contact us at info@conferience.com .



Third Party Service Providers

Conferience processes personal information on servers of our infrastructure provider in Ireland while a few other specialized third-party service providers help us as well. Therefore, we may process your personal information on a server located outside your country of residence .

Specifically, we use

SUBPROCESSOR

PURPOSE

DATA

COUNTRY OF PROCESSING

Amazon Web Services, Inc.

Infrastructure as a service

All customer data (content, contact, purchase, technical)

Ireland

Emails and virtual workplace

Contact data, purchase data

USA, Chile, Ireland, Netherlands, Finland, Belgium, Taiwan, Singapore

Commitment

We are committed to protecting your privacy. Protecting your privacy online is an evolving area, and we are constantly evolving our Service to meet these demands. If you have any comments or questions regarding our Privacy Policy, or your Personal Information that we may be storing and using, please contact us at info@conferience.com


USEFULL TERMS

Admin : an individual who is authorized by You to create, copy, delete, and hide Events within the list of Conferience Content Management System, as well as manage Your access to the Platform and Event Performance analytics. Event Organizers are Admins with access to all this information.

Agreement : collectively, these Terms and Privacy Policy.

App Store : the Apple® App Store℠, Google Play™, or other mobile application stores.

App User : an individual who gains access via any browser of any smart device and/or who downloads the native app of Conferience or any branded app created by Conferience. The App User may use the Services only for their own personal use and not for resale or distribution to any other person or entity.

Attendee : an individual that can attend the event and use the app on any kind of electronic device.

Branded app : a native app with the logo of the Organizer and all the functionality of the app, such as notifications for different features

CMS : The term refers to the Content Management System where the organizer of the event has the ability to set up an event, presentation, voting, survey or other features where they can have full control of the Conferience app environment.

Conferience Community : the group of people, organizers and/or participants that are open to ideas, discussions, updates of new features or improvements of the existing ones from Conferience

Content : all of the copyrighted materials, data, information, and other content, whether copyrighted or not, originated by You and delivered via Conferience features on the app.

Event : a gathering of two or more people/users with common interests participating either physically or virtually.

Event organizer : any kind of organizer setting up an event consisting of more than two users/participants/attendees regarding any kind of event taking place virtually or physically.

Feature : a characteristic of a platform's service of the platform that is provided to the app. Organizers can show this to the event app environment via the Content Management System

Native app : an app for a certain mobile device (smartphone, tablet, etc.) They’re installed directly on the device. Users typically acquire these apps through an online store or marketplace, such as iOS apps from Apple Store or Android Apps on Google Play.

Organizer : Anyone who decides to organize one or more events. It can be a company or an individual

Pack or Plan : the subscription plan with different prices and different features.

Participant (s): Anyone participating in an event organized by an organizer (other than themselves).

Platform : collectively, Conferience standard proprietary platform consisting of the Conferience website, Content Management System, web app and native app.

Registrant : an individual who is registered through the Login / Registration process via Conferience based on a unique email ID and password per Event, whether such ID is provided by open signup or by You.

Registration : the Conferience registration web process.

Media Wall : one of the Conferience features where participants can upload their pictures, either selfies or regular ones including the faces of other participants/users too

Service : the solutions, tools, features and support on the Conferience app offered by Conferience

Web app : The term refers to the environment the user accesses through any kind of web browser to engage at any kind of event.

You : The term user refers to any individual or body that has created a profile in order to use the content management system of Conferience as an organizer or as a participant accessing Conferience app with an event id to participate to the event’s web app.

Conferience uses Cookies

Conferience uses cookies to improve your experience on this site and personalize it based on your preferences. You can click on -Accept All- to proceed with all the cookies, or select the desired cookie categories and click on -Accept Selected-
Essential Functionality Analytics Marketing Policy Link
Why buy Conferience?
All in one. You have the power of many solutions in one platform. Valuable engagement tools for less money. The best price in the market, perfect if you don't want to derail from your budget! Ideal for events, workplace, presentations and market research.
@Events:
Event organizers of any type, such as festivals, forums, conferences, corporate events and trade shows.
@Work:
Management teams, HR, Marketing, CRM, Sales, Logistics, and other departments in your organization have now the power to engage your employees in different ways.
@Presentations:
Speakers, teachers, professors, instructors, lecturers, students, facilitators.
@Market Research:
Market researchers, focus groups, companies, and anyone who would like to collect responses from their audiences.
How to motivate and engage your participants?
With a big array of tools, from anonymity to registration, you let your people express their deeper thoughts, ideas and concerns, quickly and effectively.

If you are an Event Organizer you should know that we keep your email in our Conferience community. This way we can keep you updated on our promotions, new features or any technical or user interface improvements.
You may choose not to receive future promotional, advertising or other Service-related emails from us by selecting the unsubscribe link at the bottom of each email. Please note that, even if you opt out of receiving the foregoing emails, we will still send you a response to any “Contact Us” request as well as administrative emails (for example, in connection with a password reset request) that are necessary to facilitate your use of the Services
Advertisement
Event Organizers have the right to advertise through the app via banners, different solutions and products from sponsors or other third parties. Users accept to receive advertisements through the app.
Ownership of Your Data
You retain any and all rights you may possess to data You input and host on the Conferience platform, or data collected from others by Conferience on your behalf.
Contact information will be stored for end users that agree to provide such information through the web-app platform. In accordance with the UK Law Freedom of Information Act 2000 and Data Protection Act 1998, You have a right to view, alter and delete all personal data concerning you, collected by Conferience or its Event Organizers. To exercise these rights, You can send an email to the address
info@conferience.com
. Conferience will delete all your data up to 30 days after we receive your email.
In order to delete your account and all your data, in case you are a User, your request must be presented in writing by the email address used in registration to Conferience , or online and automatically via its platform, and, in case you are an Organizer, via the Content Management System.
Conferience agrees to make every effort to protect personal data in order to, notably, prevent this data from being distorted, damaged or communicated to non-authorized third parties. Conferience agrees to inform You in case of violation of this data, if it deems it necessary, up to 72 hours after recognizing the violation on the data.
Conferience will use Your data only for the purpose of providing web-app platform and services as contemplated hereunder and in accordance with all applicable data privacy laws and regulations. Conferience may, also, claim ownership, notably for purposes of proof, of any deed, document or recording on any medium, including established electronic media, either received or stored directly or indirectly by Conferience in a database.
Sensitive Personal Information
Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in this Agreement, Clients and Users acknowledge and agree that any use of Conferience in order to transmit, process or store Sensitive Personal Information (as defined below) is unnecessary for the use of Conferience . Therefore, Clients and Users shall be solely responsible for any such use of Conferience by Clients or their employees, agents, subcontractors and Conferience shall bear no risk or liability for the same matter. "Sensitive Personal Information" shall be defined as (a) social security numbers; (b) passport numbers or other government issued id numbers, date of birth and/or gender, except solely to the extent required by applicable regulations of the Department of Homeland Security or other government regulatory body; (c) health or medical information (other than food allergies or medical contact information); (d) financial account information; and (e) other information which a reasonable person would recognize as being highly sensitive ( excluding, for avoidance of doubt, contact information such as name, mailing address, email address, and phone number).
We will ask for your consent before using information for any purpose other than those that are set out in this Privacy Policy.
Access/Accuracy.
We wish to maintain accurate Personal Information, to the extend that you provide us with such information If you would like to delete or correct any of your other Personal Information that we may be storing, and you have difficultiy doing so alone, you may submit an access request by sending an email to
info@conferience.com
. Your email should include adequate details of your request. Notwithstanding the foregoing, we may retain certain Personal Information in connection with pending or potential legal disputes, as required by law enforcement or other government agencies, or as requested by you, in order to process and maintain records of financial transactions.
Security
The security of Personal Information is important to us. We follow generally accepted industry standards, including the use of appropriate administrative, physical and technical safeguards, to protect the Personal Information submitted to us. However, no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. Therefore, while we strive to use commercially acceptable means to protect your Personal Information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security or confidentiality. If you have any questions about security on the Service, you can contact us at
info@conferience.com
.
Third Party Service Providers
Conferience processes personal information on servers of our infrastructure provider in Ireland while a few other specialized third-party service providers help us as well. Therefore, we may process your personal information on a server located outside your country of residence .

Commitment
We are committed to protecting your privacy. Protecting your privacy online is an evolving area, and we are constantly evolving our Service to meet these demands. If you have any comments or questions regarding our Privacy Policy, or your Personal Information that we may be storing and using, please contact us at

USEFULL TERMS
Admin
:
an individual who is authorized by You to create, copy, delete, and hide Events within the list of Conferience Content Management System, as well as manage Your access to the Platform and Event Performance analytics. Event Organizers are Admins with access to all this information.
Agreement
:
collectively, these Terms and Privacy Policy.
App Store
:
the Apple® App Store℠, Google Play™, or other mobile application stores.
App User
:
an individual who gains access via any browser of any smart device and/or who downloads the native app of Conferience or any branded app created by Conferience. The App User may use the Services only for their own personal use and not for resale or distribution to any other person or entity.
Attendee
:
an individual that can attend the event and use the app on any kind of electronic device.
Branded app
:
a native app with the logo of the Organizer and all the functionality of the app, such as notifications for different features
CMS
: The term refers to the Content Management System where the organizer of the event has the ability to set up an event, presentation, voting, survey or other features where they can have full control of the Conferience app environment.
Conferience Community
:
the group of people, organizers and/or participants that are open to ideas, discussions, updates of new features or improvements of the existing ones from Conferience
Content
:
all of the copyrighted materials, data, information, and other content, whether copyrighted or not, originated by You and delivered via Conferience features on the app.
Event
:
a gathering of two or more people/users with common interests participating either physically or virtually.
Event organizer
:
any kind of organizer setting up an event consisting of more than two users/participants/attendees regarding any kind of event taking place virtually or physically.
Feature
:
a characteristic of a platform's service of the platform that is provided to the app. Organizers can show this to the event app environment via the Content Management System
Native app
:
an app for a certain mobile device (smartphone, tablet, etc.) They’re installed directly on the device. Users typically acquire these apps through an online store or marketplace, such as iOS apps from Apple Store or Android Apps on Google Play.
Organizer
: Anyone who decides to organize one or more events. It can be a company or an individual
Pack
or
Plan
:
the subscription plan with different prices and different features.
Participant
(s): Anyone participating in an event organized by an organizer (other than themselves).
Platform
:
collectively, Conferience standard proprietary platform consisting of the Conferience website, Content Management System, web app and native app.
Registrant
:
an individual who is registered through the Login / Registration process via Conferience based on a unique email ID and password per Event, whether such ID is provided by open signup or by You.
Registration
:
the Conferience registration web process.
Media
Wall
:
one of the Conferience features where participants can upload their pictures, either selfies or regular ones including the faces of other participants/users too
Service
:
the solutions, tools, features and support on the Conferience app offered by Conferience
Web app
: The term refers to the environment the user accesses through any kind of web browser to engage at any kind of event.
You
: The term user refers to any individual or body that has created a profile in order to use the content management system of Conferience as an organizer or as a participant accessing Conferience app with an event id to participate to the event’s web app.

Market researchers, focus groups, companies, and anyone who would like to collect responses from their audiences.
